clinical_study.brief_title: Hemocoagulation and Lipoperoxidation in Women Using Combined Oral Contraceptives, Correction by Antioxidants
clinical_study.official_title: The Changes of Hemocoagulation and Lipoperoxidation in Women Using Combined Oral Contraceptives With Antiandrogenic Activity, Correction by Antioxidants

brief_summary.textblock: We investigate parameters of hemocoagulation and lipoperoxidation in women using combined oral contraceptives with antiandrogenic activity (containing drospirenone with 20 or 30 mcg ethinylestradiol; or cyproterone acetate); correction of these changes by antioxidants

detailed_description.textblock:
It is well known that hormonal contraceptives using increase risk of thrombosis. We conduct parameters of hemostasis in women that use combined oral contraceptives with antiandrogenic activity for contraception and treatment. Considering relationship between lipoperoxidation in platelets and hemostasis we expect that limitation of lipoperoxidation by antioxidants can restrict hypercoagulation and decrease risk of thrombosis.
The purpose of this study is decrease of thrombosis risk in women that use combined oral contraceptives containing 20 mcg ethinylestradiol/3 mg drospirenone, 30 mcg ethinylestradiol/3 mg drospirenone, 35 mcg ethinylestradiol/2mg cyproterone acetate. Half of the women of each arm (group) receive only combined oral contraceptives (COC), other women receive combined oral contraceptives and antioxidant complex Selmevit.
The blood tests conduct on 19-21 days of the menstrual cycle before COC use (control group) or on 19-21 days of COC use after 1, 3, 6 and 12 cycles.
Also we investigate subjective tolerability, therapeutic effects, menstrual cycle control and adverse effects of COCs in women that have or have no antioxidant complex Selmevit

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Activated recalcification time
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1, 3, 6 and 12 cycles of 4 weeks (between days 18 and 21 of each cycle)

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Activated partial thromboplastin time
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1, 3, 6 and 12 cycles of 4 weeks (between days 18 and 21 of each cycle)

arm_group.description: Healthy women that no use combined oral contraceptives
Women that use combined oral contraceptives containing 20 mcg ethinylestradiol/3 mg drospirenone (Yaz)

arm_group.arm_group_label: 20 mcg EE/3 mg drospirenone and Selmevit
arm_group.description: Women that use combined oral contraceptives containing 20 mcg ethinylestradiol/3 mg drospirenone (Yaz) and antioxidant complex Selmevit
Women that use combined oral contraceptives containing 30 mcg ethinylestradiol/3 mg drospirenone (Yasmin)

arm_group.arm_group_label: 30 mcg EE/3 mg drospirenone and Selmevit
arm_group.description: Women that use combined oral contraceptives containing 30 mcg ethinylestradiol/3 mg drospirenone (Yasmin) and antioxidant complex Selmevit
Women that use combined oral contraceptives containing 35 mcg ethinylestradiol/2 mg cyproterone

arm_group.arm_group_label: 35 mcg EE/2 mg cyproterone and Selmevit
arm_group.description: Women that use combined oral contraceptives containing 20 mcg ethinylestradiol/2 mg cyproterone and Selmevit

intervention.description: One contraceptive pill in each day of 28 day cycle. Number of Cycles: 12

intervention.intervention_name: 20 mcg ethinylestradiol/3 mg drospirenone and Selmevit
intervention.description: One contraceptive pill in each day of 28 day cycle. Number of Cycles: 12. Two pills of Selmevit in each day during 30 days, repeat of the course every 3 months.
intervention.arm_group_label: 20 mcg EE/3 mg drospirenone and Selmevit

intervention.description: One contraceptive pill in each of 21 days, than 7 days break. Number of Cycles: 12

intervention.intervention_name: 30 mcg ethinylestradiol/3 mg drospirenone and Selmevit
intervention.description: One contraceptive pill in each of 21 days, than 7 days break. Number of Cycles: 12 Two pills of Selmevit in each day during 30 days, repeat of the course every 3 months.
intervention.arm_group_label: 30 mcg EE/3 mg drospirenone and Selmevit

intervention.description: 1 contraceptive pill in each day of 28 day cycle. Number of Cycles: 12

intervention.intervention_name: 35 mcg ethinylestradiol/2 mg cyproterone and Selmevit
intervention.description: One contraceptive pill in each day of 28 day cycle. Number of Cycles: 12. Two pills of Selmevit in each day during 30 days, repeat of the course every 3 months.
intervention.arm_group_label: 35 mcg EE/2 mg cyproterone and Selmevit

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women aged 18-35 years
- Absence of contraindications for COC use
- Informed voluntary consent for examination
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age younger than 18 and older than 35 years
- Refusal or failure to comply with the study protocol
- Drug or alcohol dependence
- Psychiatric diseases
- Severe somatic and allergic diseases
- Pregnancy
- Malignancies
- Taking drugs that affect haemostasis, including hormonal contraceptives during 6 months before study beginning
- Cases of thrombosis among first-line relatives in family history
- Contraindications to the COC use under Eligibility Criteria of hormonal contraception (WHO, 2012)

intervention_browse.mesh_term: Cyproterone acetate, ethinyl estradiol drug combination
